newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: German City acquires project in Munich.
newsitem.headline: German City acquires project in Munich.

text.p: German City Estates NV, a Dutch-quoted European property company, said on Friday it had agreed terms with local partners, Messrs Zwerenz and Krause, to acquire the Deckel Maho complex in Munich.
They are acquiring the project from the liquidating banks for 42 million marks.
The total complex comprises approximately 42,000 square metres of which 5,000 square metres are offices, German City Estates said in a statement.

"With the completion of the purchase scheduled for the end of 1996, CGE consortium has already agreed leases in excess of three million marks per annum, including a ten year lease on all of the office space to the city of Munich," GCE said in a statement.
The provisional rental target for the entire complex is in excess of 4.75 million marks.
